title: Anxiety-associated brain regions regulate threat responses in monkeys

title_detail.value: Anxiety-associated brain regions regulate threat responses in monkeys

summary: Damage to parts of the orbitofrontal cortex (OFC), a region within the prefrontal cortex, heightens monkeys' defensive responses to threat, according to new research. The study proposes a critical role for subregions of this brain area in different anxiety disorders.
